title: F.D.A. advisers meet for discussion on the options for updating Covid vaccines in anticipation of possible surges.
abstract: The expert panel will vote at the end of the daylong meeting on whether the vaccines should be reformulated to target Omicron or one of its subvariants, BA.4 and BA.5.

title: Democrats Press the White House for a More Assertive Response to Roe’s Fall
abstract: The initial response by President Biden and other Democratic leaders to the overturning of Roe struck many Democrats as painfully inadequate.

multimedia.caption: Abortion-rights supporters took to the streets in Manhattan after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade on Friday.

title: When Abortion Pills Were Banned in Brazil, Women Turned to Drug Traffickers
abstract: With Roe v. Wade overturned, states banning abortion are looking to prevent the distribution of abortion medication. Brazil shows the possible consequences.

multimedia.caption: The pharmacy of the university hospital in Recife. Doctors in the hospital have taken many extraneous steps when using the drug “because of the intense paranoia.”

title: In Illinois, MAGA Congresswoman Rallies to Oust Her G.O.P. Colleague
abstract: The primary contest between Republican Representatives Mary Miller and Rodney Davis has pitted a hard-right figure styling herself in Trump’s image against a traditional, pragmatic conservative.

title: Gov. Abbott has made crackdown on migrants central to his re-election campaign.
abstract: The governor has boasted of his tough stance against migrants, but his policies have failed to slow the number of people crossing the border.

title: Ed Gonzalez, Biden’s Long-Stalled Nominee to Lead ICE, Withdraws
abstract: His 14-month nomination was ensnared by immigration politics and allegations of domestic abuse, and his departure is another blow to the Biden administration on an issue where it has struggled.

multimedia.caption: In a letter to the president, Ed Gonzalez, a fierce critic of hard-line policies at the agency he was tapped to lead, said he had withdrawn “in the best interest of the nation.”

title: Mitch McConnell’s Court Delivers
abstract: While Democrats seethe, the Senate Republican leader sees the fruits of his efforts to install an aggressive conservative majority on the Supreme Court.

title: A Couple’s Long Journey in the Anti-Abortion Movement
abstract: As the fall of Roe v. Wade rocked the country, Carrie and Roger Severino celebrated the realization of decades of work that has been complicated in recent years by health challenges.

title: A Rhode Island candidate was charged after a video showed him punching an opponent at an abortion protest.
abstract: Jeann Lugo, a Republican and off-duty police officer, was suspended by the Providence Police Department after striking Jennifer Rourke, a Democrat, the authorities said.

title: Biden Irked by Democrats Who Won’t Take ‘Yes’ for an Answer on 2024

title: When an Abortion Story Is Told as a Caper, Thriller or Farce
abstract: As Roe falls, new works including a documentary, a feature film and a comedy show disrupt the taboos and clichés around abortion.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

title: Supreme Court Sides With Coach Over Prayers at the 50-Yard Line
abstract: Joseph Kennedy, a former high school football coach in Bremerton, Wash., had a constitutional right to pray on the field after his team’s games, the justices ruled.

title: Proud Boys Ignored Orders Given at Pre-Jan. 6 Meeting
abstract: The directives, given during a video conference, included obeying police lines and keeping away from ordinary protesters. But members of the far-right group played aggressive roles in several breaches at the Capitol.

title: MAGA Voters Send a $50 Million G.O.P. Plan Off the Rails in Illinois
abstract: Republican leaders think a moderate nominee for governor could beat Gov. J.B. Pritzker. But the party’s base seems to prefer a far-right state senator — and he is getting help from Mr. Pritzker.

title: 34 Senate Democrats urge Biden to take action on abortion.
abstract: With little hope of legislative action following the Supreme Court’s ruling, lawmakers urged the president to take “bold action” to defend Americans’ reproductive rights.

title: Decades Ago, Alito Laid Out Methodical Strategy to Eventually Overrule Roe
abstract: A slow-burning hostility to constitutional abortion rights runs through the career of the author of the Supreme Court opinion overturning them.
